column2: The Shipping Head is responsible for overseeing all tug and barge operations within the company's maritime. This includes managing technical, commercial, insurance, and operational aspects to ensure the safe, efficient, and compliant movement of vessels, while maximizing profitability and maintaining client satisfaction. 1. Technical Management:  - Oversee the maintenance, repair, and ongoing seaworthiness of the company's tug and barge fleet.  - Ensure vessels meet all applicable technical standards, regulations, and classification society requirements.  - Develop and implement preventive maintenance programs and dry-docking schedules.  - Manage the procurement of spare parts, equipment, and supplies for vessel operations.  - Liaise with technical consultants, surveyors, and regulatory bodies as required. 2. Commercial Management:  - Develop and implement strategies to maximize the utilization and profitability of the tug and barge fleet.  - Negotiate and manage contracts with clients, ensuring favourable terms and conditions.  - Participate in bidding processes and prepare competitive proposals for new business opportunities.  - Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments to identify growth opportunities.  - Manage client relationships, address concerns, and ensure customer satisfaction. 3. Insurance Management:  - Manage and maintain insurance policies for tugs, barges, and other company vessels.  - Ensure accurate documentation and timely renewal of insurance coverage.  - Oversee the registration and documentation process for company vessels.  - Coordinate with relevant authorities and agencies for vessel inspections and certifications.  - Administer employee insurance programs, including health, life, and disability coverage. 4. Operational Management:  - Coordinate the scheduling and deployment of tugs and barges for various shipping assignments.  - Oversee the loading and unloading of cargo onto barges, ensuring proper handling and stowage.  - Monitor vessel movements and provide guidance to tug captains and crew.  - Assign and manage crews for tug and barge operations, ensuring proper training and certification.  - Implement and enforce safety protocols, conduct risk assessments, and investigate incidents/accidents.  - Liaise with port authorities, clients, and other stakeholders to coordinate vessel movements. 5. Compliance and Regulatory Affairs:  - Ensure compliance with all applicable maritime regulations, company policies, and industry best practices.  - Stay up-to-date with changes in relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.  - Develop and implement policies and procedures to maintain regulatory compliance.  - Represent the company in interactions with regulatory bodies and industry associations. 6. Financial Management and Reporting:  - Manage operational budgets and monitor expenses related to tug and barge operations.  - Analyse financial performance, identify cost-saving opportunities, and implement efficiency measures.  - Prepare and submit regular reports on operational performance, safety metrics, and financial data.  - Collaborate with other departments (e.g., finance, procurement) to ensure seamless operations. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in maritime studies, naval architecture, or a related field. - Extensive experience in tug and barge operations, technical management, and commercial operations. - Thorough knowledge of maritime regulations, safety protocols, and industry best practices. - Strong leadership, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities. - Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. - Familiarity with insurance policies, vessel registration processes, and related regulations.   This comprehensive job description covers the various aspects of managing tug and barge operations, including technical, commercial, insurance, and operational responsibilities. The qualifications and experience requirements can be adjusted based on the specific needs of the organization and the scope of the role.
column11: Commercial, Operational Excellence, Technical, Insurance Operations
